text:
82 yo female with COPD (admitted with PNA), CAD with NSTEMI this
   admission. Pelvic ORIF [**1-14**] and has been in rehab since. Multiple
   recent admissions to [**Hospital3 735**] from rehab facility for CP and
   sputum- was ruled-out for an MI and PE, but continued to have
   re-current hemoptysis and dyspnea.
   [**4-6**]- Admit to [**Hospital3 735**] with CP/Dyspnea given ntg and BiPAP, was
   transferred to [**Hospital1 19**] cath lab when her CE
s were elevated.
   [**4-7**]: Cardiac Cath at [**Hospital1 19**] with LCx DES placed, RCA stenting c/b RCA
   dissection requiring additional stents. Arrived CCU post- procedure in
   respiratory distress requiring intubation.
   Coronary artery disease (CAD, ischemic heart disease)
   Assessment:
   NSTEMI [**2105-4-7**] s/p cardiac cat with DES to OM and 2 BMS to RCA (cath c/b
   RCA dissection).
   Low HCT.
   Action:
          Medication management including asa, plavix, statin.
          Transfused 1 unit PRBC this pm for HCT 24.8
   Response:
   Plan:
   Awaiting bedside TTE.
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 11**])
   Assessment:
   Multifactoral including baseline COPD, PNA and CHF. Prior to intubation
   on [**4-7**] had multiple episodes hemoptysis. Remote family history of TB.
   CXray showed RUL consolidation, RLL consolidation/effusion and
   pulmonary edema v. hemorrhage.
   Action:
          Chest CT this am
          Bedside bronch this afternoon.
          Meds including:
   1. po steroids & albuterol via vent for COPD
   2. IV abx (vanco and zosyn) for PNA
   3. IVP lasix for CHF (20 mg IV given with blood transfusion).
   Response:
   Plan:
   Team awaiting OSH CT results for comparison (reportedly no PE and no
   mass seen). Potentially place patient on isolation precautions for TB.
   Continue prednisone taper, albuterol, antibiotics, await results
   bronch.
